result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley W Wiita was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
58 days credit if revoked.
Concurrent with: with current probation sentence being served.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs due during the term of probation.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the governmental entities for the balance due.

Absolute sobriety
No controlled/illegal substances
No drug paraphernalia
ONLY prescribed narcotics kept in original container and taken as prescribed, must be made available to agent and law enforcement for inspection.
Submit to DNA sample before release from custody of the Ozaukee County Jail.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley W Wiita

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bradley W Wiita in court with Attorney Jeremy J Guza.  Defendant in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel files plea questionnaire. Court examines defendant and renders sentence.

Defendant Bradley W Wiita in court with attorney Jeremy J Guza. Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters not guilty plea and makes speedy trial demand. Court schedules trial date of 2/24/2016 and jury status on 2/23/2016 at 1:15 pm.
Conditions set by court: no contact with S.W., absolute sobriety, and no controlled subst/prescrip medic unless prescribed.

Defendant Bradley W Wiita in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Ozaukee County Jail. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Mcclendon waives reading of the complaint. State makes recommendation for bail. Attorney Mcclendon has no objections. Court sets bail. 
Matter adjourned until January 13, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.
